text: Russell Frank Ebert (22 June 1949 â€“ 5 November 2021) was an Australian rules footballer and coach. He was called the greatest players in the history of Australian rules football in South Australia. Ebert was the only player to have won four Magarey Medals. He was born in Berri, South Australia. Ebert was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia in late December 2020. He died from the disease on 5 November 2021 in Adelaide, South Australia at the age of 72. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Australian rules footballers Category:Sportspeople from South Australia Category:Deaths from acute myeloid leukemia
title: Russell Ebert
